00035 // $RCSfile: escaping_8cc-source.html,v $ - Miscellaneous routines for DODS HDF server
00036 //
00037 // These two routines are for escaping/unescaping strings that are identifiers
00038 // in DODS
00039 // id2www() -- escape (using WWW hex codes) non-allowable characters in a
00040 // DODS identifier
00041 // www2id() -- given an WWW hexcode escaped identifier, restore it
00042 // 
00043 // These two routines are for escaping/unescaping strings storing attribute
00044 // values.  They use traditional octal escapes (\nnn) because they are
00045 // intended to be viewed by a user
00046 // escattr() -- escape (using traditional octal backslash) non-allowable
00047 // characters in the value of a DODS attribute
00048 // unescattr() -- given an octally escaped string, restore it
00049 // 
00050 // These are routines used by the above, not intended to be called directly:
00051 // 
00052 // hexstring()
00053 // unhexstring()
00054 // octstring()
00055 // unoctstring()
00056 // 
00057 // -Todd
00058 
00059 #include <ctype.h>
00060 
00061 #include <strstream>
00062 #include <iomanip>
00063 #include <string>
00064 
00065 #include "Regex.h"
00066 #include "Error.h"
00067 #include "InternalErr.h"
00068 
00069 using std::string;
00070 using std::ostrstream;
00071 using std::istrstream;
00072 using std::setfill;
00073 using std::hex;
00074 using std::setw;
00075 using std::oct;
00076 using std::ends;
00077 
00078 const int MAXSTR = 256;
00079 
00080 // The next four functions were originally defined static, but I removed that
00081 // to make testing them (see generalUtilTest.cc) easier to write. 5/7/2001
00082 // jhrg
00083 
00084 string 
00085 hexstring(unsigned char val) 
00086 {
00087     char buf[MAXSTR];
00088 
00089     ostrstream(buf, MAXSTR) << hex << setw(2) << setfill('0') 
00090                 << static_cast<unsigned int>(val) << ends;
00091 
00092     return string(buf);
00093 }
00094 
00095 string 
00096 unhexstring(string s) 
00097 {
00098 #if 0
00099     // Originally this code returned val, the string declared below. This
00100     // does not work with g++ 2.95.2 (and I'm not sure that it ever did
00101     // work...). Note the hoops you must jump through to convert a single
00102     // char into a string object. 5/4/2001 jhrg 
00103     string val;
00104 #endif
00105     int val;
00106     istrstream(s.c_str(), MAXSTR) >> hex >> val;
00107     char tmp_str[2];
00108     tmp_str[0] = static_cast<char>(val);
00109     tmp_str[1] = '\0';
00110     return string(tmp_str);
00111 }
00112 
00113 string 
00114 octstring(unsigned char val) 
00115 {
00116     char buf[MAXSTR];
00117 
00118     ostrstream(buf, MAXSTR) << oct << setw(3) << setfill('0') 
00119                 << static_cast<unsigned int>(val) << ends;
00120 
00121     return (string)buf;
00122 }
00123 
00124 string
00125 unoctstring(string s) 
00126 {
00127     int val;
00128 
00129     istrstream(s.c_str(), MAXSTR) >> oct >> val;
00130 
00131     char tmp_str[2];
00132     tmp_str[0] = static_cast<char>(val);
00133     tmp_str[1] = '\0';
00134     return string(tmp_str);
00135 }
00136 
00144 string
00145 id2www(string in, const string &allowable)
00146 {
00147     string::size_type i = 0;
00148 
00149     while ((i = in.find_first_not_of(allowable, i)) != string::npos) {
00150     in.replace(i, 1, "%" + hexstring(in[i]));
00151     i++;
00152     }
00153 
00154     return in;
00155 }
00156 
00168 string
00169 id2www_ce(string in, const string &allowable)
00170 {
00171     return id2www(in, allowable);
00172 }
00173 
00185 string 
00186 www2id(string in, const string &escape, const string &except)
00187 {
00188     string::size_type i = 0;
00189 
00190     while ((i = in.find_first_of(escape, i)) != string::npos) {
00191     if (in.substr(i, 3) == except) {
00192         i += 3;
00193         continue;
00194     }
00195     in.replace(i, 3, unhexstring(in.substr(i + 1, 2)));
00196     }
00197 
00198     return in;
00199 }
00200 
00208 string 
00209 esc2underscore(string s, const string escape = "%[0-7][0-9a-fA-F]")
00210 {
00211     Regex escregx(escape.c_str(), 1);
00212 
00213     int index=0, matchlen;
00214     while ((index = escregx.search(s.c_str(), s.size(), matchlen, index)) != -1)
00215     s.replace(index, matchlen, "_");
00216 
00217     return s;
00218 }
00219 
00234 string 
00235 char2ASCII(string s, const string escape = "%[0-7][0-9a-fA-F]") 
00236 {
00237     Regex escregx(escape.c_str(), 1);
00238 
00239     int i=0, matchlen;
00240     while ((i = escregx.search(s.c_str(), s.size(), matchlen, i)) != -1) {
00241     if (escape == "%[0-7][0-9a-fA-F]" && matchlen == 3)
00242         s.replace(i, 1, "_");
00243     else {
00244         if (matchlen != 1)
00245         throw InternalErr(__FILE__, __LINE__, "A caller supplied value for the regular expression in escape should match exactly one character.");
00246 
00247         unsigned char ascii = *(s.substr(i, 1).data());
00248         ostrstream ostr;
00249         ostr << "_" << hexstring(ascii) << ends;
00250         s.replace(i, matchlen, ostr.str());
00251         ostr.freeze(0);
00252     }
00253     }
00254 
00255     return s;
00256 }
00257 
00261 string 
00262 escattr(string s) {
00263     Regex nonprintable("[^ !-~]", 1);
00264     const string ESC = "\\";
00265     const string DOUBLE_ESC = ESC + ESC;
00266     const string QUOTE = "\"";
00267     const string ESCQUOTE = ESC + QUOTE;
00268 
00269     // escape non-printing characters with octal escape
00270     int index = 0, matchlen;
00271     while ( (index = nonprintable.search(s.c_str(), s.size(), matchlen, index)) != -1)
00272     s.replace(index,1, ESC + octstring(s[index]));
00273 
00274     // escape " with backslash
00275     string::size_type ind = 0;
00276     while ( (ind = s.find(ESC, ind)) != s.npos) {
00277     s.replace(ind, 1, DOUBLE_ESC);
00278     ind += DOUBLE_ESC.length();
00279     }
00280 
00281     ind = 0;
00282     while ( (ind = s.find(QUOTE, ind)) != s.npos) {
00283     s.replace(ind, 1, ESCQUOTE);
00284     ind += ESCQUOTE.length();
00285     }
00286 
00287     return s;
00288 }
00289 
00298 string 
00299 unescattr(string s) {
00300     Regex escregx("\\\\[01][0-7][0-7]", 1);  // matches 4 characters
00301     Regex escquoteregex("[^\\\\]\\\\\"", 1);  // matches 3 characters
00302     Regex escescregex("\\\\\\\\",1);      // matches 2 characters
00303     const string ESC = "\\";
00304     const string QUOTE = "\"";
00305     const string ESCQUOTE = ESC + QUOTE;
00306 
00307     // unescape any octal-escaped ASCII characters
00308     int index = 0, matchlen;
00309     while ( (index = escregx.search(s.c_str(), s.size(), matchlen, index)) != -1) {
00310     s.replace(index,4, unoctstring(s.substr(index+1,3)));
00311     index++;
00312     }
00313 
00314     // unescape any escaped quotes
00315     index = 0;
00316     while ( (index = escquoteregex.search(s.c_str(), s.size(), matchlen, index)) != -1) {
00317     s.replace(index+1,2, QUOTE);
00318     index++;
00319     }
00320 
00321     // unescape any escaped backslashes
00322     index = 0;
00323     while ( (index = escescregex.search(s.c_str(), s.size(), matchlen, index)) != -1) {
00324     s.replace(index,2, ESC);
00325     index++;
00326     }
00327 
00328     return s;
00329 }
00330 
00331 string
00332 munge_error_message(string msg)
00333 {
00334     // First, add enclosing quotes if needed.
00335     if (*msg.begin() != '"')
00336     msg.insert(msg.begin(), '"');
00337     if (*(msg.end()-1) != '"')
00338     msg += "\"";
00339 
00340     // Now escape any internal double quotes that aren't escaped.
00341     string::iterator miter;
00342     for (miter = msg.begin()+1; miter != msg.end()-1; miter++)
00343     if (*miter == '"' && *(miter-1) != '\\')
00344         miter = msg.insert(miter, '\\');
00345 
00346     return msg;
00347 }

00410 // Revision 1.16.2.6  2001/10/08 16:58:17  jimg

00414 // Revision 1.18  2001/08/24 17:46:22  jimg
00415 // Resolved conflicts from the merge of release 3.2.6
00416 //
00417 // Revision 1.16.2.5  2001/08/22 06:21:19  jimg
00418 // Added id2www_ce(). This function calls id2www but uses an allowable
00419 // character set that larger than id2www(). It allows []{}: and & in the CE
00420 // part of a DODS URL. This was added to keep the new clients from breaking
00421 // old servers.
00422 //
00423 // Revision 1.16.2.4  2001/07/28 00:49:26  jimg
00424 // Changed the names and function of id2dods/dods2id. The new functions are
00425 // called id2www and www2id. They use C++ strings, not Regexs. They scan
00426 // their inputs and escape/unescape characters for the WWW. The character set
00427 // that's allowed in a URL is defined by RFC 2396, ``Universal Resource
00428 // Identifiers (URI): Generic Syntax.'' We're using that to determine which
00429 // characters must be escaped and which are OK as is. For example, a dash (-)
00430 // is allowed in a URL. Note that dashes are now processed by our parsers,
00431 // too. Spaces, hashes (#), et c. are not allowed in a URL and will be
00432 // escaped by id2www and unescaped by www2id.
00433 //
00434 // Revision 1.17  2001/06/15 23:49:04  jimg
00435 // Merged with release-3-2-4.
00436 //
00437 // Revision 1.16.2.3  2001/05/16 21:09:19  jimg
00438 // Modified www2id so that one escape code can be considered exceptional
00439 // and not transformed back into its ASCII equivalent. This is used by
00440 // DODSFilter to suppress turning %20 into a space before the CE is feed
00441 // into its parser. This means that somewhere further down the line the
00442 // strings need to be scanned again for escapes (which should then be only
00443 // %20s).
00444 //
